intro: Draba draboides, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers in early spring. It is part of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. Draba draboides is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments and is often found in meadows and scree slopes.
